comments.commentBody:
Having seen your state before you took office, and observing it now, I would say your failure as governor is only surpassed by your blindness to reality. You are a product of outside influences that are unfamiliar with the traditional values of your state. That the NYT published anything flowing from your pen is just evidence that they put you forward to the public for the ridicule you deserve.

Come to Minnesota and see what honest democracy looks like. We have yet to fine any benefit from denying the franchise to anyone and our voter participation is the envy of the nation. If you had any confidence in your leadership you would not be suppressing the vote.
One of your best Mr Eisenberg.

Walker's drug testing of "people seeking public assistance" showed a rate of less than one percent drug use while the national rate of illicit drug use among the general population is ten times greater. Perhaps all those tax dollars would be better spent on drug treatment for the general populace?
https://aminewswire.com/stories/511050837-wisconsin-drug-testing-rule-na...
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/nationwide-trends

“Explain that the centerpiece in the Republican agenda — returning authority to the states — is the best solution to our nation’s problems.”

So if the solution to all of our problems is to return authority to the states, why do the Republicans selectively choose when state’s rights are irrelevant. For example, what about California’s right to set it’s own car emissions standards?

From The New York Times, “The E.P.A. will also begin legal proceedings to revoke a waiver for California that was allowing the state to enforce the tougher tailpipe standards for its drivers.” https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/03/us/politics/trump-vehicle-emissions-r...

The problem, Governor Walker, is the Republican’s constant hypocrisy on this and so many other issues. Maybe I could consider the merit of your argument if there was any kind of consistency to it.
I wonder who's running for president again?

What is the evidence that Governor Walker's policies have resulted in lowered unemployment? Wisconsin' unemployment rates have come down since the Great Recession, but that's true of every other state, as well. It's also a fact that joblessness in Wisconsin is below the national average, but that was already the case before Walker took office.

What incredible nonsense from a stuffed-shirt Republican who had the gall to seek the party nomination for President!

Modern America is an interstate nation, much more than a collection of states. Our nation was created by recognizing the British-delineated states that existed at the time of the Revolution, and over time, admitting new states to cover acquired territory. The new states were delineated willy-nilly to serve as administrative units in an age of subsistence living and poor communications.

Today, we are burdened with 50 anachronistic states, each with a chief executive, a legislature, and a judiciary that parodies the federal government. These states are not geographically and demographically delineated to serve as useful administrative units. They are burdensome, corrupt, and comical obstacles between national and local governance. Goodness, they even managed to precipitate the most devastating war in our history, the War Between the States.

Devolve significant functions like infrastructure, education, civil rights, voting rights, health care, economic development, and employment support to the states? A sure recipe for mediocrity and division, guaranteed to leave southern and middle America stuck in the 19th century with aging and declining populations.

Using Walker's logic President Obama and the 2008 Democratic controlled Congress should have forged ahead and just passed universal healthcare or Medicare-for-all instead of listening to Republican discontent and settling for Obamacare. Same with immigration reform.
The 2008 election gave Obama and Democrats a much larger mandate than Trump and the GOP in 2016. Obama's 365 electoral was much bigger than Trump's 306, and Obama received 10 million more votes than his opponent while Trump received 3 million less than his opponent.
I don't think he wants our tax dollars go to the states. He want them to go to a blister military, and in filling holes left by the gifts to millionaires and billionaires...

What price Treason? Republicans insisted on an independent prosecutor on something as little as Bill Clinton and Monica Lewinsky. Now we have Trump and all his men lying about not having contact with Russians; Republicans still insisting we only need in house investigations, yet even the ‘in house’ FBI withholding information from another congressional investigative committee. It’s time we started using the word Treason.

Yes, Republican leaders, stand strong against your angry constituents! Close your ears to the peaceful, vociferous citizenry insisting that you listen to the collective outcry against your taking away our civil rights, our healthcare, our clean water and air. The people are indeed angry, aware, organized, and have long memories.
Stand strong, Republicans! Don't listen to the voice of the people, as we organize to vote you back to the century from whence you came.

I can  not more disagree with the author of this article  on some many points. But will start with one regarding leaving healthcare to the states for one. If this is the case then how can one on a point that the current Administration is behind at the moment but give it a day can change. How can at the state level can you make a health plan be enforced across state lines. Another point like many things large that have effect over millions of people of a states healthcare is exspensive not all states are flush with cash as others are. There needs to be some standardizations their are 50 states and territories after all. But those are just a few points among many others.

You confronted a 100,000 protesters and lived to tell about it. How proud you must be! How did you confront them exactly? I live 3 blocks from the State Capital and frequently joined the protests. I didn't notice you there attempting to engage with anyone there.

You did not campaign for governor promising to destroy the unions immediately after being elected. That was a promise you made to the Koch brothers.

The protest were all peaceful. The participants were teachers, policemen, firemen, students and others from a broad spectrum of life experiences. I just bet there were some non-liberals there.

You take credit for everything good that is happening in the local and national economy. You should also take credit for the divisiveness and mean spirited tone you initiated in your very special way.

Let's not forget about the night after passing Act 10 when the brave republican legislators boarded a bus and headed to the airport to travel to Washington to party with their billionaire friends!  The protests were peaceful.  There was no confrontation!

Mr. Walker,
you are correct to make a statement, 'put up or shut up', but for a right reason. The question is, 'what is the right reason'? Right reasons must not be lies, cheats and cover ups. States must do right things and must have authorities for its own people irrespective of party affiliation not because of to preserve GOP's propaganda. Republicans in Wahington are not in sink to each other and are busy to protect each leader's power without thnking what is good for people and the country.

So, the idea is that states should be supporting themselves financially? Then can we assume that you'll refuse the 28% of Wisconsin revenues that come from the Federal government? That you won't be calling on FEMA to cope with any natural or man-made disasters in Wisconsin? That you'll start repairing all your highways on your own? That you'll forego the millions of dollars that your local police departments receive in block grants and equipment?

No, I didn't think so. More hypocrisy.

Were there editing errors throughout this essay? It seemed that several key words were missing:

Lopped off after "taxpayers" were the words "who are rich enough to pay for services."

Deleted after "people" were "who belong to racial, ethnic and religious groups we are comfortable with."

Curtailed after "states" were the words "that have historically deprived workers, the poor and minorities of equal rights."

After "employers" should have appeared the words "who have outshored, outsourced, or simply disappeared tens of millions of jobs to increase their already historically high profits."

I know The Times is trimming their editorial staff, but really!

Meeting, exchanging comments, and meeting with Russian ambassadors (as all senators do for their job) is very different than a PRIVATE MEETING and speaking about specific policy.  The democrats cannot believe Clinton lost well she did get over it and stop the allegations and conspiracy theory.
And there he stood on the Gerald Ford, with his cute little suit on.

Thank you for sharing your insights, Al. In today's Wall St Journal, Peggy Noonan clutched her pearls and marveled at 45's speech to Congress, saying how the rest of the world saw how presidential he is, and could now see what his supporters have seen all along. She concluded, breathlessly, that he may have a capacity to grow into the office. Based on what, I have no idea. He's 70 years old and has yet to show growth anywhere.  He's the same petty, bombastic, lying narcissist he's always been. And always will be.

And now Trump is tweeting that Nancy Pelosi should be investigated for her "ties" to Russia.

Remember, with Trump he always accuses others of what he's doing.

This is going to get ugly.

What did Sessions say about Bill Clinton meeting with the AG at the airport during the election?
Seriously, someone remind him.
Bye Jeff you lying liar.
Gail, "he probably did" told me all I need to know about both the president and his AG. One's a liar and the other knows it. Game. Set. Match.
Racist. Dishonest. Lying under oath.  Maybe that is not the person who should be leading us in law?  Just thinking...
Mistresses? Is that the word for it now??

But Hillary got more votes than Donald, so-o-o-o, looks like the
Russians' clumsy efforts in fact helped .... her? And Donald put away 16 other
very able politicians, including blue-chip Jeb, so I guess somehow the
Russians made that happen?

Oh well, when will you crying-baby Democrats get over it?

We're the crybabies?

Nobody show him mr. trump's Tweet storms...
